org.cpsolver.ifs.algorithms.neighbourhoods

Class SuggestionMove<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cpsolver.ifs.algorithms.neighbourhoods.RandomSwapMove<V,T>
      • org.cpsolver.ifs.algorithms.neighbourhoods.SuggestionMove<V,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Variable
    T - Value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    HillClimberSelection, NeighbourSelection<V,T>

    public class SuggestionMove<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>
extends RandomSwapMove<V,T>
    Suggestion move. A variable is selected randomly. A limited depth backtracking is used to find a possible change (much like the suggestions in UniTime when the interactive solver is used). Unlike in NeighbourSelectionWithSuggestions, the very first found suggestion is returned. The depth is limited by SuggestionMove.Depth parameter (defaults to 3). Also, instead of using a time limit, the width of the search is limited by the number of values that are tried for each variable (parameter SuggestionMove.MaxAttempts, defaults to 10). When used in HillClimber, the first suggestion that does not worsen the solution is returned.
    Version:
    IFS 1.3 (Iterative Forward Search)
